Affiliate - Any organization or individual interested in the general
furtherance of educational broadcasting.
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based
on rated transmitter power, as follows:
Class A - 5 kw and over - $50.00
Class B - 1 - U.9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw - 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and those
with 5 kw or more video power pay $100.00.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10.00 a year. For this fee members
receive our monthly Newsletter: the various reports and surveys we publish
periodically; services of our Placement Service, television engineer, legal
counsel, management consultant, etc.; plus the normal day-to-day services,
information, and advice that any national organization gives its members.
In the attached envelope I am enclosing the latest issue of the Newsletter
plus a few brochures which will tell you more about the NAEB and its activi-
ties.
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee. The Net¬
work distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape record¬
ing, weekly, to members subscribing to its service. This fee is also
based on power (with the same power classifications as membership) and a
new station does not have to pay the full fee until the third year it is
in the Network. The fees are:

There, in brief, is the information you wanted, and we*re looking forward
to your application for membership. Hope you will forgive our apparent
stupidity about the School of the Air situation, but I*m sure you under¬
stand, and we would appreciate your answers to the questions I*ve raised.
If we can answer any other questions or send you any other information,
please let me know.
